abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project for Montenegro were as follows: outcomes
            were unsatisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: only with
            involvement of both central and local authorities and their
            commitment to sustainable development of tourism through
            capital investments, these kinds of projects can be
            satisfactorily implemented. Capital investments should have
            as a result the benefit for the whole local population, but
            in the same time should secure the protection of environment
            and sustainable spatial development, which consequently
            requires substantial institutional strengthening. For
            implementation of all high-risk projects from environmental
            point of view, the domestic institutional and legislative
            framework has to be adopted. This also includes a wide
            public information and public awareness campaign, so that
            each citizen of the beneficiary country realizes all the
            benefits and all the risks of the certain project. This
            campaign has to be realized prior or at the beginning of
            implementation of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Montenegro - Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project  : Montenegro - Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project

repnme.cdata!:
Montenegro - Montenegro Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project for sustainable
            tourism development will assist Montenegro in better
            designing and implementing an integrated coastal zone
            management approach to reduce coastal degradation and at the
            same time foster environmentally sound tourism development.
            The project has the following components: Integrated coastal
            zone management policy and institutional capacity building
            will finance improvements in land-use planning and
            protection to guard against uncontrolled construction and
            development. Coastal environmental infrastructure component
            will finance investments for the continental and southern
            part of the regional water supply scheme to provide water
            from Lake Skadar to the Municipality of Bar. Project
            management and monitoring component will finance consultant
            services, training, equipment and incremental costs for
            project management, coordination, monitoring and evaluation.

docna.cdata!:
Montenegro - Montenegro Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project

repnme.cdata!:
Serbia and Montenegro - Montenegro
            Sustainable Tourism Development Project : resettlement
            policy framework

abstracts.cdata!:
The Serbia Montenegro Sustainable
            Tourism project has three groups of people that may be
            affected by investments in the area of Skadar Lake,
            Bujana-Buna delta, and municipalities Bar and Ulcinj. The
            actual number of groups and the way they will be affected
            will be determined once the final designs for the project
            are in place. The anticipated people and their respective
            entitlements are: the land owners who will be compensated
            market price for their land if land acquisition is
            necessary; olive wood orchard owners will be entitled to
            production value of first crop and production value of trees
            if removal of the orchards is necessary; and business owners
            will be compensated for replacement values of structures and
            lost income during transition (this applies to owners and
            employees) if the structures need replacement.

            Sustainable Tourism Development Project : resettlement
            policy framework

repnme.cdata!:
Montenegro - Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project : environmental impact assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project for Montenegro (MSTDP) is to assist the
            Republic of Montenegro to better design and implement and
            integrated coastal zone management approach aimed at
            reducing coastal degradation and at the same time fostering
            environmentally sound high quality tourism development. This
            environmental impact assessment (EIA) evaluated
            environmental risks associated with the project and
            recommends measures to mitigation them. In this regard
            mitigation measures include : ensure proper applicability of
            the Republic of Montenegro existing laws and regulations
            related to the protection of the environment, and the Bank
            's operational policy on the protection of the
            environment; exert constant pre-treatment monitoring and
            constant water quality parameters during and after water
            treatment; to avoid dust, exhaust gases and noise, modern
            machinery and periodic maintenance will be enforced during
            construction phase; to keep high levels of population
            health, some local water sources with questionable water
            quality will be disconnected from the water supply network
            after the RWSS completion; access roads to the construction
            site will be adequately maintained, and regularly sprayed
            with water to reduce propagation of dust; vehicles used for
            transport of materials will be covered and regularly washed
            to facilitate dust  prevention and cleaning; hunting and
            disturbance of wildlife will be avoided; all solid waste
            generated on the construction sites will be collected and
            disposed at the appropriate city landfill; wood, paper,
            glass, and plastic containers will be properly collected,
            separated, stored and disposed at the sanitary landfill on
            Podgorica; excess excavation material (soil) will be
            transported and disposed to the local construction material
            landfill; and finally; health and safety of construction
            workers will be enforced through provision of adequate
            equipment and training on environmental best practices.

display_title.display_title:
Montenegro - Sustainable Tourism
            Development Project : environmental impact assessment :
            Environmental impact assessment study
